document.title: Calendar
document.description: Use the calendar component to create custom date pickers

body.raw:
## Static Prop

Set `static` to make the date picker static and not select dates on click.

<CalendarIndicatorDemo />

## Custom date pickers

Use the `Calenedar` component along with the `getDayProps` function to build your own custom date pickers.

<WeekPickerDemo />

## Hiding outside dates

Use the `hideOutsideDates` prop to hide dates outside the current month.

<CalendarHideOutsideDatesDemo />

## Overriding styles

Use the `classNames` prop to pass custom class names to the calendar. The following example makes all weekends purple

<PurpleWeekendCalendar />

document.title: Date Picker
document.description: Use the date picker component to create date pickers that match your design.

body.raw:
<DatePickerDemo />

## Controlled state

The following example uses a state value to keep track of the date range and renders it in a popover.

<DateRangeInPopoverDemo />

## Number of columns

The date picker can be configured to show a different number of columns. Using the `numberOfColumns` prop. The following example shows a date picker with 2 columns.

<DatePickerTwoColumnDemo />

## Min and max dates

You can set the minimum and maximum dates that can be selected using the `minDate` and `maxDate` props.

<MinMaxDateDemo />

## The size prop

The `size` prop can be used to change the size of the date picker. Sizes xs, sm, md, lg, and xl are available.

<DatePickerWithSizeDemo />

document.title: Getting Started
document.description: How to install and use the calendar

body.raw:
## Initializing `@shadcn/ui`

Before you can use the calendar component, you need to initialize the `@shadcn/ui` package.
This will add the necessary CSS to your project.

<InitializeShadCnCode />

## Installing `@you-got-bud/calendar`

Install the calendar compoent with the package manager of your choice.

<InstallCalendarCode />

## Setting up tailwindcss

We need to tell tailwindcss to include the calendar styles in the build.

<TailwindContent />

## Using the Date Picker

Now you can use the date-picker/calendar in your project refer to the [calendar](/docs/calendar) and [date-picker](/docs/date-picker) for more information.
